Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "无法获取未定义或 null 引用的属性“split”" (#7639) at vuejs/vue
Events.RelatedBody:
### Version
2.2.6

### Reproduction link
[https://jsfiddle.net/mohaiyo/50wL7mdz/97951/](https://jsfiddle.net/mohaiyo/50wL7mdz/97951/)

### Steps to reproduce
Step1: copy the code from jsfiddle to an index.html (I'm sorry but the jsfiddle don't support the IE9 document mode so you have to reproduce this bug this way)

Step2: open the index.html file by IE browser or 360 browser

Step3: F12 Open the debugger. Choose the userAgent IE10 or IE11(must be 360 browser ) by simulation tool

step4:click the datePicker component then you can see the error--无法获取未定义或 null 引用的属性“split”

### What is expected?
There is no error on IE when the browser mode(IE10 or IE11) incompatible with the document(IE9) mode .

I know this bug is caused by transition,but how can I fix it?

### What is actually happening?
There is an error "无法获取未定义或 null 引用的属性“split”" when js run!

---
can vue add an feature to remove tansition?

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[vue-router] Failed to resolve async component default: TypeError: Invalid calling object" (#2057) at vuejs/vue-router
Events.RelatedBody:
<!--
IMPORTANT: Please use the following link to create a new issue:

  https://new-issue.vuejs.org/?repo=vuejs/vue-router

If your issue was not created using the app above, it will be closed immediately.
-->
# Version
3.0.1

# What is expected?
That i am navigated to the correct page. This is working correctly in chrome and firefox.

# Router Coding
``` code
const router = new Router({
    mode: 'history',
    routes: [
        { path: '/', redirect: '/dashboard' },
        { path: '/login', component: resolve => require(['../page/login/login.vue'], resolve) },
        {
            path: '/Dashboard',
            component: resolve => require(['../components/frame/frame.vue'], resolve),
            children: [
                {
                    name: 'Dashboard',
                    path: '/',
                    component: resolve => require(['../page/dashboard/dashboard.vue'], resolve)
                }
            ]
        }
    ]
});
```

# Question
In IE 11, visit the /login page, such as the title error when accessing /Dashboard

# Error
[vue-router] Failed to resolve async component default: TypeError: Invalid calling object

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "$route.query contains %20 error" (#2056) at vuejs/vue-router
Events.RelatedBody:
My link like this

    _http://localhost:8080/#/wxPlan?loc=24.486022,118.195058&spotArea=5LiJ5Y2D5YWr55m%205Z2O_

then i get the spotArea in created function like this:

    ```
let params={
      loc: this.$route.query.loc,
      spotArea: this.$route.query.spotArea
    }
    console.log(this.$route.query)
```

the results:
{loc: "24.486022,118.195058", spotArea: "5LiJ5Y2D5YWr55m 5Z2O"}

the Special symbol "+" was missed.

how do i do it？ thinks a lot。
